question: When someone talks about an experience, is responding only with your own similar experience the best response?
answers: Yes only if your experience was pretty much exactly the same
Yes because you're still on topic so it still respects what the other person was saying
No because you can talk about your experience after you tell them your feelings on their experience
feedback: Even if you have a smilier experience as someone else, make sure to still give them a response that is unique to THEM

question: Why can it be good to bring up a personal experience?
answers: It makes you look more interesting
It can help to connect with the other person more
For the most part, you shouldn't talk about yourself at all when someone is telling you an experience
feedback: Sharing your own personal experiences can help you and the other person feel more connected. Just don't only share your experiences.

question: When meeting someone new, wouldn’t bringing up personal experiences a lot help them get to know me better?
answers: Yes but not fully engaging with what they’re saying makes you miss who they are.
Yes because they can learn many facts about you quickly
No because telling someone personal experiences doesn’t help people get to know you better
feedback: Sharing your own experiences helps others get to know you but make sure you engage with the other person to get their personality as well
